entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_pullreq_received
entry.text: A pull request was received to pull message payload from MPC '%s' for user name '%s'.
entry.description: A pull request is received. The B2B Gateway uses the user name and MPC information to match the message payload to pull.

entry.name: ebms_pullreq_invalid_username_fail
entry.text: The user name that is associated with the received pull request message is not valid. The B2B Gateway cannot decide which message to pull from the MPC.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_empty_mpc
entry.text: No message is available for pulling in MPC '%s' for user '%s'.
entry.description: No message is available for pulling in this MPC at this moment. The reason might be that all messages in the MPC are consumed, or the message producer has not submitted the messages to the MPC yet.
entry.suggestion: If you still have messages that are not acquired yet, send another pull request against this MPC later.

entry.name: ebms_mpc_matched
entry.text: Found matched message payload in MPC '%s' for user '%s'.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_generating_usermsg_reply
entry.text: Generating a user message in response to the pull request message '%s'.
entry.description: The B2B Gateway is generating the ebMS3 user message from the pulled payload in response to the received pull request.

entry.name: ebms_receive_usermsg_reply
entry.text: Received an ebMS3 user message in response to the sent pull request '%s'.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_del_mpc_msg_failed
entry.text: Delete action (%1$s) failed. Reason: %2$s.
entry.description: Failed to delete the specified message from the MPC.
entry.suggestion: Resolves issues that are reported in the reason of the failure.

entry.name: ebms_notify_recep_aware_sync
entry.text: Start to send a new reception awareness error notification to message producer with URL '%1$s' for transaction '%2$s'.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_unexpect_encrypted_message
entry.text: An encrypted message was received, but the B2B Gateway requires an unencrypted message.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_compression_failed
entry.text: Failed to compress the outbound ebMS message.
entry.description: Failed to compress the outbound ebMS message due to internal error or lack of resources.

entry.name: ebms_compression_succeeded
entry.text: Successfully compressed the outbound ebMS message.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_decompression_failed
entry.text: Failed to decompress the inbound ebMS message.
entry.description: Failed to decompress the inbound ebMS message due to internal error or lack of resources

entry.name: ebms_decompression_succeeded
entry.text: Successfully decompressed the inbound ebMS message.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_unexpect_compressed_message
entry.text: A compressed message was received, but the B2B Gateway requires an uncompressed message.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: inbound_data_not_compressed
entry.text: The inbound message was not compressed, but the B2B Gateway requires a compressed message
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_submit_username_too_long
entry.text: The user name that is associated with the submitted message payload exceeds the maximum length. The current length of the user name is %zd.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_submit_mpcname_too_long
entry.text: The MPC name that is associated with the submitted message payload exceeds the maximum length. The current length of the MPC name is %zd.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_submit_invalid_valcred_fail
entry.text: The validation credential that is associated with the submitted message payload is not valid.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_submit_mpc_msg_valcred
entry.text: Submitting the message payload that is associated with validation credential '%s' into MPC '%s'.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_pullreq_invalid_valcred_fail
entry.text: The certificate that is carried with the received pull request message cannot be validated against the validation credential of the MPC. The B2B Gateway cannot decide which message to pull from the MPC.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ebms_empty_mpc_valcred
entry.text: No message is available for pulling in MPC '%s' for the certificate that is carried with the received pull request message.
entry.description: Although the pull request passes the MPC authentication through its certificate, no message is available for pulling in this MPC at this moment. The reason might be that all messages in the MPC are consumed, or the message producer has not submitted the messages to the MPC yet.
entry.suggestion: If you still have messages that are not acquired yet, send another pull request against this MPC later.

entry.name: ebms_pullreq_received_valcred
entry.text: A pull request was received to pull message payload from MPC '%s' against validation credential '%s'.
entry.description: A pull request is received. The B2B Gateway uses the validation credential authentication method and MPC information to match the message payload to pull.

entry.name: ebms_mpc_matched_valcred
entry.text: Found matched message payload in MPC '%s' against validation credential '%s'.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_stop_error
entry.text: Persistence store error while shutting down.
entry.description: The persistence store might not have been shut down gracefully.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: noraid
entry.text: No RAID volume present
entry.description: The persistence store requires the hardware RAID volume to be present for the B2B gateway to function.
entry.suggestion: Use a DataPower Gateway with the RAID option.

entry.name: nostart
entry.text: The persistence store failed to start
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: notrunning
entry.text: The persistence store is not running
entry.description: The persistence store is required to process the request, but it is not running.
entry.suggestion: Check the system logs for related errors.

entry.name: failed_send
entry.text: Internal error in B2B persistence store
entry.description: An unexpected error occurred trying to save or retrieve data.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: persistence_starting
entry.text: Persistence store is starting
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_failed_init
entry.text: Persistence store initialization failed
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_failed_connection
entry.text: Persistence store connection failed
entry.description: Cannot establish a data connection to the persistence store.

entry.name: persistence_started
entry.text: Persistence store started
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_alloc_failed
entry.text: Persistence store allocation failure
entry.description: The persistence store made a memory allocation request that failed.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that appropriate memory resources are available.

entry.name: persistence_handle_alloc_failed
entry.text: Persistence store handle allocation failure
entry.description: A request to the persistence store to allocate storage failed.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that appropriate memory resources are available.

entry.name: persistence_stmt_failed
entry.text: Persistence store statement execution failed. RC=%d
entry.description: A request to the persistence store to run a statement failed.

entry.name: persistence_commit_failed
entry.text: Persistence store transaction commit failure
entry.description: An error occurred when attempting to commit a transaction to the persistence store.

entry.name: persistence_not_created
entry.text: Persistence store will be created
entry.description: The persistence store does not exist. Attempting to create it.

entry.name: persistence_already_created
entry.text: Persistence store check succeeded
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_ipc_error
entry.text: Error communicating with persistence store
entry.description: An error occurred during a persistence store request. The request cannot be processed.

entry.name: resultserror
entry.text: Error creating persistence store results
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: paramtoolong
entry.text: Provided persistence value too long
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: sidecar_not_started
entry.text: Persistence process failed to start
entry.description: The persistence store process could not start. Failure is most likely due to resource shortage.
entry.suggestion: Check the system logs for more details.

entry.name: persistence_startup_unknown_error
entry.text: Persistence store initialization failed: unknown error
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_connections_remain

entry.name: persistence_startup_invalid_handle

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_invalid_license

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_nodatabasefile

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_server_running

entry.name: persistence_startup_failed_open

entry.name: persistence_startup_failed_connect

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_failed_test
entry.text: Persistence store initialization failed: initial testing of the persistence store failed

entry.name: persistence_startup_repair_failed

entry.name: persistence_startup_creation_failed_exists

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_creation_failed

entry.name: persistence_startup_conversion_failure

entry.name: persistence_startup_communication_failed
entry.text: Persistence store initialization failed: communication with the persistence store could not be established

entry.name: persistence_startup_illegal_arguments

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_change_dir

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_input_file

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_output_file

entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_startup_corrupt_file
entry.text: Persistence store initialization failed: possible RAID disk corruption
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_downgrade_warning
entry.text: Warning: You are about to load an earlier firmware version. Loading an earlier firmware version might prevent all B2B gateways from becoming operational and will require an administrator to initialize the persistence store again.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Archive your transaction data before continuing.

entry.name: persistence_bootswitch_warning
entry.text: Warning: You are about to switch firmware versions. Switching to an earlier firmware version might prevent all B2B gateways from becoming operational and will require an administrator to initialize the persistence store again.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Archive your transaction data before continuing.

entry.name: persistence_startup_invalid_version
entry.text: Because of a downgrade, the persistence store is incompatible with the current firmware.
entry.description: Because of a firmware downgrade, perhaps as the result of a roll back, the version of the persistence store is now at a later level than the firmware. The data in the persistence store is safe, but all B2B gateways are "down".
entry.suggestion: Roll back to the original firmware that can access the persistence store and archive the data in the persistent store. If you already archived the persistence store, roll back to the later firmware and initialize the persistent store again to make it accessible in the current firmware.

entry.name: sidecar_died
entry.text: Unexpected persistence store failure: the persistence store will be temporarily unavailable while it is restarted.
entry.description: An internal error has caused the persistence store to restart. Even though the operational state of the persistence store remains "up", transactions will fail while the restart is in progress.

entry.name: sidecar_init_failed
entry.text: Permanent persistence store failure. Cannot start the persistence store.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: If the firmware was recently installed, switching back to the last installed firmware version might restore the persistence store.

entry.name: no_persistence_data
entry.text: Cannot find the persistence data.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Try to enable HA, which should synchronize the server.

entry.name: ha_connection_status_change
entry.text: The connection status for the highly available persistence store changed to '%s'.
entry.description: The persistence store detected a change in its connection status to another DataPower Gateway in the high availability cluster.
entry.suggestion: Check the system logs to determine why the status changed.

entry.name: ha_state_change
entry.text: The role of this DataPower Gateway in the high availability cluster changed from '%1$s' to '%2$s'.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Check the system logs to determine why the role changed.

entry.name: ha_netcopy_req
entry.text: The secondary DataPower Gateway in the high availability cluster requested a persistence store update.
entry.description: The persistence store requested that its local copy be synchronized with the cluster.

entry.name: ha_netcopy_end
entry.text: The secondary DataPower Gateway in the high availability cluster completed a persistence store update.
entry.description: The persistence store synchronized its local copy with the cluster.

entry.name: ha_switch_to_primary_failed
entry.text: The DataPower Gateway cannot become the primary member of the high availability cluster: '%s'
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway detected a condition where it needed to become the primary member of the cluster. However, the DataPower Gateway cannot become the primary member.

entry.name: ha_switch_to_primary_succeeded
entry.text: The DataPower Gateway became the primary member of the high availability cluster.
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway detected a condition where it needed to become the primary member of the cluster. The DataPower Gateway became the primary member.

entry.name: persistence_startup_innetcopymode
entry.text: Persistence store initialization failed: in netcopy mode
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: ha_secondary_initialize_succeeded
entry.text: Initialized the persistence store for secondary member in high-availability cluster.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: persistence_connection_failed_innetcopymode
entry.text: The persistence store is in netcopy mode. Cannot established a connection.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Try your transaction after the persistence store is no longer in netcopy mode.

entry.name: ha_init_secondary_failed
entry.text: The DataPower Gateway failed to be initialized as the secondary member of the high availability cluster: '%s'
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway detected a condition where it needed to become the secondary member of the cluster, but was unable to.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the B2B persistence configuration is disabled and HA setting is not enabled

entry.name: archive_failed
entry.text: Archive process failed
entry.description: Failed to archive transactions to the specified archive target.
entry.suggestion: Check the archive target settings and ensure that the connection between the DataPower Gateway and archive target can be established.

entry.name: archivecmdfailed
entry.text: Archive action (%1$s) failed. Reason: %2$s.
entry.description: Failed to process the request to archive B2B transaction data. The data was not purged or archived.
entry.suggestion: Verify the stated reason.

entry.name: archivecmdfailed_b2b_persistent
entry.text: Archive action (%s) failed because B2B Persistence object is not op-state up.
entry.summary: %s is the command issued to archive
entry.description: Failed to execute the archive command. B2B persistence object is disabled
entry.suggestion: Verify B2B Persistence object is enabled.

entry.name: archivecmdfailed_no_gateway_found
entry.text: Archive action (%s) failed because no gateway was found.
entry.summary: %s is the command issued to archive
entry.description: No gateways were found to archive
entry.suggestion: Verify the domain selected to archive all B2B gateways. If default domain is selected all b2b gateways will be archived.

entry.name: archivecmdfailed_no_gateway_name
entry.text: Archive action (%s) failed because no gateway name was specified.
entry.summary: %s is the command issued to archive
entry.description: No gateway name was specified to archive.
entry.suggestion: View usage of b2bp-archive-now command
